intro: Coussarea antioquiana, commonly known as the Antioquian coussarea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the cloud forests of western Colombia, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, lance-shaped leaves, and clusters of small, white flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species in the wild.
